AuthorName.Title: [PDF] Neural SZZ Algorithm
AuthorName.Content: L Tang, L Bao, X Xia, Z Huang;The SZZ algorithm has been widely used for identifying bug-inducing commits. However, it suffers from low precision, as not all deletion lines in the bug-fixing commit are related to the bug fix. Previous studies have attempted to address this issue by using static methods to filter out noise, eg, comments and refactoring operations in the bug-fixing commit. However, these methods have two limitations. First, it is challenging to include all refactoring and non-essential change patterns in …• Cites: ‪Evaluating szz implementations through a developer-informed oracle‬
